meanings.definition: To spread through or permeate every part of
meanings.sent1: The smell of fresh cookies pervaded the entire house.
meanings.sent2: The sound of laughter pervaded the park on a sunny day.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous giggles of the children pervaded the quiet library.
meanings.sent4: The sense of excitement pervaded the room like a colorful mist.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of blooming flowers pervaded the garden, inviting bees and butterflies.

meanings.definition: One who pervades or spreads throughout
meanings.sent1: She was known as the pervader of positivity in the office.
meanings.sent2: The artist was a true pervader of creativity in the community.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was a pervader of joy, always bringing smiles to everyone.
meanings.sent4: The leader was a pervader of change, inspiring others to follow.
meanings.sent5: The teacher was a pervader of knowledge, enlightening young minds with wisdom.
